docs.lead_paragraph: DURING the last decade of the nineteenth century a group of poor and ignorant folk gathered in the backlands of Brazil around a man known as "Antonio the Counselor," who was said to work miracles. They were illiterate, undernourished and weather-beaten people with a natural craving for a happier life.

headline.main: LITERARY MILESTONE IN BRAZIL; Euclides da Cunha's Fine Study In an English Translation
